meanings.definition: A series of arches supported by columns or piers.
meanings.sent1: The ancient building had beautiful arcading that added elegance.
meanings.sent2: The cathedral's arcading was a stunning architectural feature.
meanings.sent3: The arcading in the palace made the visitors feel like royalty as they walked through.
meanings.sent4: The arcading of trees in the forest created a natural cathedral-like atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The intricate arcading in the museum was a sight to behold, drawing in many visitors.

meanings.definition: The act of constructing or adorning with arches.
meanings.sent1: The skilled craftsmen were experts in arcading, creating beautiful structures.
meanings.sent2: The art of arcading requires precision and attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The playful arcading of balloons at the party added a festive touch.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a poetic arcading that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The arcading of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: A covered passageway with shops or stalls on either side.
meanings.sent1: The bustling market was filled with vendors along the arcading.
meanings.sent2: The arcading provided shelter for shoppers as they browsed the goods.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loved to hide and play in the arcading of the alley.
meanings.sent4: The arcading of clouds in the sky created a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent5: The arcading of lights in the street market gave it a festive glow.
